SandraDodd@... writes:
> People who pretend that if they don't get their unschooling information here
>
> they can't get it at all are just being troublemakers. Still, I do think
> the
> best unschooling information available anywhere these days is at
> www.unschooling.com, and this is a subset of that entity.

AMEN!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Ned, censorship, yoda yoda
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/8/03 8:53:09 PM, pamhartley@mindspring.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/8/03 8:53:09 PM, pamhartley@... writes:

<< Don't you KNOW that Sandra has Ultimate Power and controls the thoughts and
behaviors of us all, most especially Helen (list owner) and Joyce (list
moderator)? >>

I thought I told you never to say that.

No steak knives for you this round.

I'm not happy when people become obsessed with me. It's embarrassing for me,
and SHOULD be embarrassing for them. But I'm not going to stop writing
about unschooling. I'm not writing everywhere. There's an AOL unschooling
board (sad little thing, but still there), there are lots of sites I'm never
on, and likely lots I've never heard of. I'm here, on Always Learning,
HEM-Unschooling, and at www.unschooling.com. That's not the whole unschooling
universe.

People who pretend that if they don't get their unschooling information here
they can't get it at all are just being troublemakers. Still, I do think the
best unschooling information available anywhere these days is at
www.unschooling.com, and this is a subset of that entity.

Sandra
